text: Oin, Óin or OIN may refer to: ==Folklore and fiction== * Óin, son of Gróin, a Dwarf from J. R. R. Tolkien's writings, companion of Thorin Oakenshield * Oin- Oin, a character of Swiss folklore ==Other== * Open Invention Network, a company specialising in patent with Linux * Oneida Indian Nation, the New York tribe that operates Turning Stone Resort & Casino * One language, specifically Inebu, by ISO 639-3 code ==See also== * Eoin, an Irish name pronounced O-in
title: Oin
